name: Dinner Tonight: Moong Dal and Red Lentils with Browned Onions
description: This dish relies on two kinds of pulses, the yellow moon dal and regular red lentils.  You could easily substitute all red lentils for this and it would still be pretty good: the real secret is in the fragrant topping, a pile of browned onions, chiles, and spices, bathed in screaming hot ghee and poured over the top of the dish.  Once you stir them in, they perfume the humble lentil like you wouldn't believe.
recipeIngredient: 4 tablespoons ghee, clarified butter, or vegetable oil
1 small onion, cut into thin rings

recipeInstructions.text: Combine both lentils in a bowl and cover with several changes of cold water. Drain well and transfer to a heavy-bottomed pot. Add water and turmeric and bring to a boil over high heat; reduce to simmer, cover loosely to prevent boiling over, and cook 40-50 minutes until lentils are tender, stirring ocassionaly. Season with salt.

In the meantime, heat the ghee or oil in a small saute pan over medium heat until shimmering. Add asafetida and cumin seeds and allow cumin seeds to sizzle for a few seconds, then add chiles and cook until starting to darken, just a few seconds. Add onion and cook until brown and beginning to crisp, turning heat down if necessary to prevent burning.
Transfer onion mixture to lentils and cover pot, allowing to sit for a few minutes to trap the aromas. Serve with cooked white rice.
